page.title: 19TRANSPORT
page.content: Because of its isolation, public transport in Durness is very limited. There is a daily bus service to Lairg via Kinlochbervie departing at 8.45 a.m. and returning about 5.00p.m. This bus carries the mail as well as passengers. Very few people use the service and it is heavily subsidised by Highland Regional Council. Roads to Durness are single track with passing places. These roads are very narrow and twisty, particularly the road east round Loch Eriboll. The A838 from Tongue to Lairg via Durness is the longest stretch of single track "A" class road left in Scotland. Other services are a monthly WRVS mini- bus to Inverness for hospital visiting and a Red Cross car for those who have no transport to and from hospital. It is also possible to hire a mini-bus locally for group outings.
